page.title: 15Religion in E.Hagbourne
page.content: The church still plays an important role in these communities. In East Hagbourne there are 2 churches, St Andrews(Anglican) and the Methodist Chapel which was built in 1884. St Andrews is an active parish and produces a magazine every month with general information on events, letters, meetings etc. Within the church itself there are many architectural features dating from the 15th century, one of the most important is the coat of arms of Charles I discovered beneath a painting which was being cleaned. This probably has a link with the period when Charles I took refuge in East Hagbourne from the Roundheads. Recently there has been much fund raising to restore the bellcote of which there are only a few left in the country. It houses the ancient Sanctus bell.
